result.execSummary:
The defendant Dean L. Hopinka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Dean L. Hopinka was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dean L. Hopinka is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Dean L. Hopinka was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

charges.dispoDesc: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.

Huber / work release granted for any purpose the Law allows.
Defendant to submit DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dean L. Hopinka

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Doctor Kimberly Clawson

Defendant appears requesting a medical furlough to collect date for doctors to make evaluation or in the alternative reduce defendant's sentence.  Court reviews medical documents but will not grant furlough or a reduced sentence.

records.descr: Petition for sentence adjust denied - summarily

records.addlTxt: Defendant is requesting a petition for sentence adjustment, however his is not in prison so does not apply.  Wants to get out of jail for medical reasons.  Court will notify jail of medical requests.  Court will re-evaluate the request if he gets specific information from his treating doctors.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: from girlfriend

Defendant Dean L. Hopinka in court with attorney Sara Elizabeth Jordan.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA recommends 6 months jail & $500 fine + costs.  Arguments by Attny Jordan.  Defendant makes a statement.  Court orders $500 + costs, DNA sample, 6 months jail w/Huber comm. 1/4/16.
2 verdicts
and Peremptory Challenges

Defendant Dean L. Hopinka in court with attorney Sara Elizabeth Jordan.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
8:35 a.m. in chambers - Discussion of pretrial items.  Court makes findings regarding past crimes of potential witnesses.  D. H. - 9, T. P. - 0.  Discussion on in-limine issues.  Witnesses will be sequested.  Officer Wudtke can stay at counsel table.  In chambers voir dire if needed based on question asked by the Court.

Exhibits 1-5 marked for State before starting.
9:04 a.m.  Court convenes.  Jury panel receives oath #1.  Voir fire or the jurors, questions by the Court.  In chamber voir dire of juror #60.  Back in court to continue voir dire.  Questions by Atty. Parker.  Juror #76 excused for cause.  Questions by Atty. Jordan.  Juror #78 excused for cause.  Counsel make their strikes.  Jurors #57,64, 73, 49, 67, 71, 66, 46, 35, 59, 74 & 45 are selected and receive oath #2.  Jury panel is seated.  Court takes a recess @ 9:54 a.m.

Court reconvenes @ 10:09 a.m.  Opening instructions given by the Court.  Opening remarks by counsel.  Detective K. Sorlie, sworn in and testifies while questioned by Atty. Parker.  Exhibit #3 identified as 3 pages of photographs.  Cross-exam by Atty. Jordan.  Exhibit #3 offered and received.  Analyst M. Freund sworn in and testifies while questioned by Atty. Parker.  Exhibit #4 identified as Lab findings report.  Cross-exam.  Exhibit #4 offered and received.  Witness is released.  Officer W. Wudtke sworn in and testifies while questioned by Atty. Parker.  Exhibits #6, 7, & 8 marked and identified; offered and received.  Exhibit #9 marked and identified; offered and received.  Exhibit #1 & 2 identified, offered and received.  Jury is excused @ 12:00 p.m.  Parties stipulate to prior conviction (Exhibit #5).   Court recesses for lunch @ 12:03 p.m.

Court reconvenes @ 1:01 p.m.  Jury returns and is seated.  Officer Wudtke returns to the stand and is cross-examined by Atty. Jordan.  Exhibit #10 - 13 marked and identified as photographs.  Exhibits 10 - 13 offered.  Not received yet by the Court.  Redirect by Atty. Parker.  Evidence Tech A. Holcomb sworn in and testifies while questioned by Atty. Parker.  State rests.  Jury is excused @ 1:27 p.m.  Court recesses @ 1:29 p.m.

Court reconvenes @ 1:40 p.m. and jury is seated.  Defense chooses to present evidence.  T. P. is sworn in and testifes while questioned by Atty. Jordan.  Cross-exam by Atty. Parker.  Defendant is sworn in and testifies on his own behalf.  Questioned by Atty. Jordan.  Objection - hearsay. Court admonishes witness.  Objection as non-responsive.  Overruled.  Objection to hearsay.  Sustained.  Cross-exam by Atty. Parker.  Redirect by Atty. Jordan.  Exhibit #13 received.  Court recesses @ 2:53 p.m.

Court reconvenes @ 3:02 p.m.  No rebuttal.  Jury instructions reviewed and discussed.  Jury returns @ 3:08 p.m.  Closing arguments by counsel.  Court gives closing jury instructions.  Bailiff's are sworn in.  Jury retires to deliberate @ 3:44 p.m.

Court reconvenes @ 3:57 p.m.  Jury has reached a verdict.  Clerk reads the verdicts and polls the jury.  Unanimous decision.  Court thanks the jury for their service and excuses them @ 3:59 p.m.  Sentencing date to be set along with other cases still pending.

Defendant Dean L. Hopinka in court with attorney Sara Elizabeth Jordan.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions defense regarding witness list. Atty Jordan will provide.  DA Parker - offers are revoked.  Atty Jordan questions deadline for motions.  Court sets deadline 1 week prior to trial.

Final pre-trial at 09-01-2015 11:00 am.
Jury trial at 10-08-2015 08:30 am.
